intro: Bebbia juncea var. aspera, commonly known as rough bebbia, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, woodland habitats and is often found in shaded areas. The rough texture of its leaves, as indicated by the varietal name "aspera," is a distinguishing botanical feature.
